matador_BusinessLogic

Class GameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • matador_BusinessLogic.GameController

  • public class GameController
extends Object
    Starts the game and handles communication between Game and the boundaries. The rules can be modified with a constructor, the extra options are:
    • twoOnes If true you will lose all you points by rolling the values 1 and 1 in the same turn.
    • twoSame If true you will gain an extra turn by rolling two of the same values in one turn.
    • toSixes If true you will win if you roll two sixes in two consecutive turns.
    • win52 If true winning required 52 points and then rolling two of the same values.
    • gui If true turns on the GUI.

    As standard all these conditions are set to true, and the number of Die and Player instances is set to 2. Using the non standard constructor these conditions and the number of players can be changed. For this particular game having anything but two number of Dice does not make sense so that cannot be changed.

    Author:
    Martin Caspersen
    See Also:
    Game, BoundaryToPlayer, BoundaryToGUI

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameController

        public GameController()
        Creates the game with 2 Die, 2 Player instances and a requirement of 52 points to win. All the extra conditions will be turned on when using this constructor. Spiller 1 will start the game when using this constructor.
        See Also:
        Game

      • GameController

        public GameController(int numPlayers,
              int startPlayer,
              boolean twoOnes,
              boolean twoSame,
              boolean twoSixes,
              boolean win52,
              boolean gui)
        Creates the game with 2 Die and numPlayers Player instances. Using this constructor the starting player and extra conditions can be changed.
        Parameters:
        numPlayers - int number of players has to be greater than 0.
        startPlayer - int, starting player [0:numPlayers-1].
        twoOnes - if true you will lose all you points by rolling the values 1 and 1 in the same turn.
        twoSame - if true you will gain an extra turn by rolling two of the same values in one turn.
        twoSixes - if true you will win if you roll two sixes in two consecutive turns.
        win52 - if true winning requires 52 points and then rolling two of the same values.
        gui - if true turns on the GUI.

        Starts the first round of the game.

        public static void addPlayer(String name,
             int balance,
             int carColor)
        Adds a Player to the GUI board with name, balance and carColor as provided.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the Player as a String.
        balance - balance of the Player as an int.
        carColor - color of the Players car as an int.

      • getPlayerAccept

        public static boolean getPlayerAccept(int activePlayer)
        Sends an int to the boundary, the physical player is to enter the same int to accept to roll.
        Parameters:
        activePlayer - int representing the active Player [0:numPlayers-1]
        Returns:
        true if the player accepts to roll.
        See Also:
        BoundaryToPlayer

      • setDice

        public static void setDice(int[] facevalues)
        Will set the dice on the GUI to the facevalue of the Dies instances in the game if gui is true.
        Parameters:
        facevalues - Array of ints containing the facevalue of all the Dice in the game.
        See Also:
        BoundaryToGUI

      • showStatus

        public static void showStatus(int[] facevalues,
              int[] playerPoints)
        Shows the status of the game. BoundaryToPlayer is responsible for formatting the two provided Array of ints.
        Parameters:
        facevalues - Array of ints containing the facevalues of all the Dice in the game.
        playerPoints - Array of ints containg the points of all the Players in the game.
        See Also:
        BoundaryToPlayer

      • showString

        public static void showString(String toShow)
        Outputs the provided String to the physical player.
        Parameters:
        toShow - String to output.
        See Also:
        BoundaryToPlayer

        Closes the Scanner used by BoundaryToPlayer to get input from the physical player.
